Posts.Content: Feb 9, 2010 03:05PM Anna2 wrote: My hair all came back on my head, but all of my eyebrows did not. I have some, but my eyebrows used to be thick. Has anybody have this happen and if so, did your eyebrows eventually come back? I have been out of chemo for 9 months now.
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Feb 9, 2010 02:59PM Anna2 wrote: Hi all! I know this was posted a while ago, but if this helps anyone out there now, I will add my 2 cents. I finished my chemo in May of 2009. It is Feb. 2010, and my hair is about 2 and 1/2 inches long. It has come back thicker, very, very curly (pretty curls, not frizz) and much darker than it was. No gray, all dark brown, but I never had gray before. My hair was stick straight and blonde before. I like my new hair. Before that, I had three different wigs I wore, and then a lot of scarves. I was glad when my head was covered with hair so I could go without!
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Feb 10, 2010 01:32PM Anna2 wrote: MarieK,  You may get my straight blonde hair after all! I like variety so this dark curly hair is so different. I am enjoying it. You may enjoy the straight look. Everyone wanted to guess how my hair was going to come back. They all wanted to touch it. It amazing how much emphasis is put on hair, isn't it? Lots of luck!
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Feb 21, 2010 10:11PM Anna2 wrote: Thanks for your post, Soccermom. You are another survivor and an inspiration for those of us with HER2+ You have made my day!
Posts.Title: Stage II w/Lymph Node Involvement Warrior517 Moderators

Posts.Content: Feb 21, 2010 10:05PM Anna2 wrote: Warrior 517, I like your poem. You are very talented!  I related with most of it. I have just finished my treatment and the port is out, but I realize that  I will have to fight for the rest of my life so it won't come back. I, too, had HER2+and the doctor said there is a 35% chance it will come back. Is that what you were told? I had two surgeries, lymph node involvement, chemotherapy, Herceptin, radiation, and now, am on Arimidex for five years. I am 53.
Posts.Title: Stage II w/Lymph Node Involvement Warrior517 Moderators
